basics.name: Reuben K. Coutinho
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a self-taught, driven and self-motivated volunteering software developer with a strong background in web and mobile technology. I am a Mixed/Augmented/Virtual Reality enthusiast and a postgraduate from Queensland University of Technology.

highlights: Design, build and test web-based applications and edit site content for various components using content management system (CMS).
Create and manage web pages, add/edit content and upload/remove documents using CMS. Maintain website standards and comply with predefined design guidelines.
Educated the broader audience within the company on Mixed, Augmented and Virtual Reality and implementing better design techniques.

Designed the architecture of OffGrid (An offline way to order a Uber ride). This will help 21% of Australian without smartphone to order an Uber. Built the entire application using MongoDB, NodeJs and Expressjs (MEN Stack)
Worked on a React-native based mobile application for OffGrid
Gathered requirements for internal project, OffGrid (An offline way to order a Uber ride) [https://offgrid.global]
Encrypted user's details to protect privacy, and encoded the hash with details to help retrieve the information.
Oriented the team through an agile (SCRUM) process and helping refine the process.
Solely maintained a C# based mobile application using Xamarin
Give technical advice/feedback to marketing when consulted.
Experimented with AWS to host the OffGrid application on the cloud for better management and scalability.
Gathered requirements for an internal project to develop a health monitoring tool for Claims-center.
Demonstrated prototypes of the product.

Worked with a team of interns, in an Agile fashion, to successfully deliver the product using Spring-boot, hosted on an AWS instance. This product reduced the immediate efforts of managers having to follow up with the technical leaders to find out the health of the system.
Oriented the interns team through an agile (SCRUM) process
Helped reduced team efforts by making Proof of Concepts on storing information using AWS S3 buckets.
Developed LDAP-based authentication module using Node.js for internal use.
Solely maintained an existing PHP web application for contractor compliance (https://www.arm-cc.com).
Reduced processing time by 95% by modifying existing code which helped the customer handle orders quicker.
Manually tested each build before the release. This allowed to detect and fix bugs before committing the release.
Released Bi-weekly versions into production and oversaw performance.

work.summary: Worked on QML/Javascript based inflight entertainment systems used by most of the world's airlines, including Qantas and Jetstar.
highlights: Maintained and added features to Seat-chat, Video, Audio, Radio modules.
I was the team expert on the Seat-chat module responsible for adding features like group chat and online presence, while maintaining the consistency across already implemented systems.
We released weekly versions to QA and releases to customer every 3 months.
I contributed to the framework code for validation, which reduced the efforts needed by developers.

work.summary: Sandbox Infotech was a startup company that provided IT Solutions for local and international businesses.
highlights: Contributed to an existing PHP web application for foreign exchange. https://www.moneynetint.com
Integrated a CMS into existing system to update information.This decreased development efforts by 10%.
Applied latest HTML5 standards to UI.
Manually tested each release.
Released weekly versions into live production.
Introduced Unit testing to existing code base.
Facilitated multi-language website for different users.

volunteer.summary: Made beanies for babies in Nepal and wrote postcard for sick kids around the world.
Global movement of free coding clubs for young people.
Helped set up the robots for a finale performance and made sure the performance went smoothly.
Developed, delivered and installed new website theme using PHP and Wordpress.
highlights: Before: http://www.wildlife.org.au/magazine/index.html
After: http://magazine.wildlife.org.au

volunteer.summary: Solely delivered and installed PHP website theme for Mentally Disturbed Citizens Association.

projects.title: OffGrid using NodeJS
projects.summary: As part of my final year project part 2, I reflected work done at Sky Black Box to build OffGrid. The purpose of the app is to be able to order an Uber using SMS.

projects.title: Interactive Dashboard for better decision making using Springboot/Java
projects.summary: As part of my final year project part 1, I reflected work done at Suncorp Insurance to build a dashboard by collecting service data and process health and producing meaningful charts to help make better decisions.

projects.title: Sensing Sleep Apnea using Xamarin and wearable technologies
projects.summary: As part of my curriculum, I had to build a mobile based app that incorporated mobile and pervasive systems to help solve a societal problem. Our group chose to create an app to detect if a person has sleep apnea. Although we didn't have test subjects to try it out on, we managed to connect to the wearable device, which is the CMS50IW and collect data from it. This was the first time I was working on a cross-platform solution and it was very challenging as it was excited to work with Xamarin(Although time constraints didnâ€™t allow me to complete the iOS version of the application).

projects.title: Translation Application for RESX file I18N
projects.summary: This application was created to demonstrate how RESX files can be used for translation and allowed to translate an RESX file from one language into another. Users can also use online services like Bing Translator or Google Translate.

participation: Past member of QUT Connectors to help students transition into university life.

awards.title: Dean's list for Excellent Academic Performance

participation: Competed in Student Driving Robotics Competition  CVRDE, Chennai, India.
